title: Practical Inductive Methodology for Applied Geography and Planning (K-12)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic geography concepts and quantitative/qualitative research methods
context.additional_context: Data Collection and Analysis Environment Using Digital Devices, Strengthening Group-Based Project Learning

learning_goals: Students can inductively analyze real-world geographic planning problems to derive conceptual frameworks
Learners can compare and evaluate various research methodologies to select the most suitable one for case-specific contexts
Participants can visualize spatial data using digital tools and document the interpretation process
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
